item.title: Ex-GTA Boss Dan Houser Thinks AI Is Overrated
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Rockstar Games co-founder Dan Houser may have included an advanced AI as a plot in his new novel, A Better Paradise: Volume One - An Aftermath, but he's not as impressed with the current state of the technology. During a recent appearance, Houser didn't completely downplay AI, but he noted that the technology isn't everything some of its proponents have made it out to be.

While making a guest appearance on Channel 4's Sunday Brunch, Houser acknowledged that his upcoming video game based on A Better Paradise may have some AI. But he also warned that the technology behind AI can't live up to its biggest promises yet.

"We are dabbling in using AI, but the truth is a lot of it's not as useful as some of the companies would have you believe yet," said Houser. "It's not going to solve all of the problems, you know. We have a whole field of areas we need technology for and AI is great at some of the tasks and can't do the other tasks yet."

Houser was subsequently asked about the future of gaming now that AI technology is part of it, and he suggested it will land somewhere between art and commerce.

"[Gaming] can either go somewhere really interesting or somewhere that gets overly focused on making money," said Houser. "I think there's always that danger with any commercial art form that they get distracted by money. But I think there's still a big ceiling creatively to make these kind of living narrative experiences, and I think that was what we were always trying to do."

When asked if he thought the pursuit of money or creativity would win in the end, Houser clarified that both will win.

"I think there will be two parts," said Houser. "I've already seen that in spaces in the games industry where they both kind of win."

Earlier this month, Ubisoft was called out for including AI-created art in Anno 117: Pax Romana. Activision was less contrite when taken to task for the apparently AI-created "Ghibli-style" Calling Cards seen in Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. The company subsequently acknowledged that some AI was used in the creation of Black Ops 7 Meanwhile, Arc Raiders has come under fire for using AI voiceover readings. Congressman Ro Khanna subsequently called for regulation over the use of AI.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 BlackCell DLC Revealed For Season 1, How To Unlock It And Everything It Includes
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 and Warzone's Season 1 arrives on December 4, and alongside new maps, guns, and modes, there is a new BlackCell DLC bundle coming.

The centerpiece of the new BlackCell offering is the new operator, Scorn, who is exclusive to the BlackCell offering. Beyond the new playable character, the new BlackCell DLC pack lets players grind through a BlackCell path of the Season 1 Battle Pass, and it unlocks all of this content immediately:

  • The “Scorn” BlackCell Operator Skin. This Operator is also unlocked for you to use.
  • 1,100 COD Points
  • The “Ultimatum” Mastercraft Blueprint for the Carbon 57 SMG with Triangular Yellow Tracers and Shimmering Deletion Death FX
  • The “Heavy Fire” Companion Finishing Move, featuring Dorne’s pet D.A.W.G.
  • The “Clock Out” Gun Screen you can attach to any weapon that accepts it.
  • The “BlackCell” Clan Tag (showcased in Lobbies and Winner’s Circles).
  • The “BlackCell No.1” HUD Theme (available in the Career > Customize > HUD Presets Menu).

There are an additional 21 items that BlackCell owners can get within the Season 1 Battle Pass; these include the following:

  • Seven BlackCell-exclusive skins, including:
    • Instant Reward Page: The “Adjutant BlackCell” Skin for Dorne (Instant Reward Page)
    • BP Completion Page: The “Disharmony BlackCell” Skin for Dorne
    • Page 2: The “Mauler BlackCell” Skin for Dempsey
    • Page 4: The “Ravage BlackCell” Skin for Zaveri
    • Page 7: The “Reboot BlackCell” Skin for Anderson
    • Page 9: The “Chemtrail BlackCell” Skin for Richtofen
    • Page 12: The “Wayward BlackCell” Skin for Samuels
  • Seven BlackCell-exclusive Weapon Blueprints:
    • Page 1: The “Firing Line BlackCell” Blueprint for the MXR-17 Assault Rifle
    • Page 5: The “Wolfhound BlackCell” Blueprint for the Echo 12 Shotgun
    • Page 8: The “Liquid Cooled BlackCell” Blueprint for the Razor 9mm SMG
    • Page 10: The “Drumbeat BlackCell” Blueprint for the XM325 LMG
    • Page 11: The “First Light BlackCell” Blueprint for the Kogot-7 SMG
    • Page 13: The “Reconditioner BlackCell” Blueprint for the M8A1 Marksman Rifle
    • Page 14: The “Neuroslicer BlackCell” Blueprint for the Maddox RFB Assault Rifle.

As with previous BlackCell offerings in past games like Black Ops 6, players who buy the BlackCell bundle after already purchasing the Battle Pass will get 1,100 COD Points back.

Finally, Activision confirmed that people who buy the BlackCell DLC get extra daily challenges throughout Season 1 that aren't available to other people. The BlackCell DLC bundles are some of the more expensive Call of Duty offerings, coming in at around $30. They have proven to be very popular with fans, so it's no surprise to see the BlackCell bundles continue with Black Ops 7.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Dice Game Is Now Available IRL
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Much like The Witcher 3's Gwent card game, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's dice game is now a collectible you can buy and play in real life. Farkle Dice wasn't an invention of the game's developer, Warhorse Studios, but it's fitting that Deliverance 2 has received a branded version of it that's available for purchase.

If you've ever wanted to bring a bit of #KCD2 into real life... this farkle set exists outside the game - a full wooden board and dice, take it on trips, play it with friends. Link below! pic.twitter.com/ROuP4dOl55

— Warhorse Studios (@WarhorseStudios) November 24, 2025

The official Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Farkle Dice set is sold by a company called Wulflund, and it isn't cheap. It's going for $151.38, and it comes with 12 wooden dice and a board made from wood and iron.

Many of the strategies from GameSpot's guide to Farkle Dice games in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 are applicable to playing the game in real life. But it's still going to take some practice to fully understand the rules and how to play.

Wulflund is also selling a replica of Sir Radzig's longsword that's even more expensive at $1,303 dollars before taxes and shipping. You'll need a kingly wage to afford that Deliverance 2 collectible.

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is one of the best-selling games of 2025, and one of the nominees for Game of the Year at The Game Awards. A "cinematic cut" of Deliverance 2 was screened at a European film festival earlier this year. The second DLC story for the game, Legacy of the Forge, was released in September.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Real-Life Pokemon Mega Dimension Donuts Could Hint At Returning Legendary Pokemon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Pokemon Legends Z-A: Mega Dimension is set to launch next month, and excitement is already building as fans anticipate its Hoopa-focused storyline and the return of several classic Pokemon, including new Mega Evolutions. To mark the upcoming release, The Pokemon Company is partnering with the Pikachu Sweets Pokemon Cafe in Tokyo to introduce a themed menu inspired directly by the DLC's mysteries and motifs. These limited-time offerings aim to give fans a preview of what awaits in the expansion, in an edible form.

The highlight of the promotion is a pair of striking new donuts, currently referred to only as the Red Donut and Blue Donut--names chosen to avoid spoilers before launch. Despite the intentionally vague labels, their designs unmistakably resemble Groudon and Kyogre, the legendary Pokemon featured on the covers of Pokemon Ruby and Pokemon Sapphire. The official website even playfully teases their origins with the line: "They look like some kind of Pokemon…?", suggesting that these real-world treats may hint at major Legendary appearances within the DLC itself.

The Red Donut will have a strawberry and tea Flavor, with the Blue Donut having a banana and lemon flavor. Both cost 550 yen.

Two drinks will also be available. Standard hot drinks featuring a special Hoopa or Gulpin design will be on sale during the promotion. A special drink, Hoopa's Mischief Ruby Chocolate Frappe, will cost 864 yen. The drink will be bright pink and feature an edible Hoopa on the top.

"This orange-flavored chocolate frappe is inspired by the mischievous Pokemon Hoopa," the description reads. "It's pink, yet chocolate-flavored! It’s just like Hoopa's mischief. Mix the refreshing orange flavor with the chocolate sauce at the bottom of the cup for a rich, varied taste."

Rounding out the themed lineup, the cafe will also serve a selection of playful hot drinks--each decorated with limited-edition Hoopa or Gulpin latte art--to keep fans warm during the winter launch window. These drinks join the already show-stealing donuts as part of the full collaborative menu, creating a small but memorable tasting tour through some of the motifs and mysteries players can expect to encounter in Mega Dimension. And of course, no Pokemon event would be complete without some kind of merch, so if you order a donut-and-drink set, it earns you an exclusive Pikachu Sweets sticker.

The new menu drops Wednesday, December 10, 2025, through Sunday, March 1, 2026, timed to coincide with the launch of the DLC itself on December 10. With Mega Dimension promising new Mega Evolutions, a Hoopa-centered narrative, and possible Legendary surprises, these treats offer a whimsical first taste of what's to come.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/real-life-pokemon-mega-dimension-donuts-could-hint-at-returning-legendary-pokemon/1100-6536478/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
